description: 2-hour written exam covering all course topics, including mathematical calculations, derivations, and short written/sketched answers. Tests knowledge of dynamical processes, computational models, and application of equations to real-world systems.

Three written assignments (Weeks 4, 7, 10) requiring worked solutions. Focus on approach, clarity of explanation, and referencing. Includes computational modeling of atmosphere/ocean dynamics and application of simplified equations.
Presentation of assignment solutions in online tutorials (Weeks 4, 8, or 10). Assessed on clarity of discussion and active participation. Mandatory for course completion.
